titles.title: State Waste Empowerment and Enforcement Provision Act of 2007
State Waste Empowerment and Enforcement Provision Act of 2007
To authorize States to regulate the receipt and disposal of out-of-State municipal solid waste.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment and Hazardous Materials.

bill.summary: State Waste Empowerment and Enforcement Provision Act of 2007 - Amends the Solid Waste Disposal Act to authorize a state to limit, place restrictions on, or otherwise regulate out-of-state municipal solid waste received or disposed of annually at each landfill or incinerator in the state, except, until two years after enactment of this Act, to the extent that a host community agreement (between an owner or operator of a landfill or incinerator and an affected local government) specifically authorizes such receipt.
